description: In vivo display of VHH nanobodies on AAV capsid surface for high-affinity binder identification.
objectives: Identify high-affinity VHH binders via AAV capsid display
Screen insertion at VR-IV and VR-VIII variable regions
Evaluate multiple linker designs for optimal display
constraints: This project is for binder identification, NOT AAV gene therapy development
Capsid must remain functional for packaging and transduction
VHH must be surface-exposed in assembled capsid

VR-IV.name: Variable Region IV (Loop 4)
VR-IV.description: Primary insertion site for VHH display
VR-IV.notes: Well-characterized insertion site. Maintains capsid assembly in most designs.

VR-VIII.name: Variable Region VIII (Loop 8)
VR-VIII.notes: Less commonly used but viable for VHHs that fail at VR-IV.
known_issues: Lower display efficiency than VR-IV in some serotypes

high_affinity_binders.rationale: Moderate flexibility allows binding without steric clash. Asymmetric design minimizes insertional footprint.

low_affinity_binders.rationale: Rigid presentation may enhance avidity effects. Structural stabilization helps weak binders.

unknown_affinity.rationale: Maximum flexibility for initial screening. Can optimize linker after hit identification.

aav_specific_rules.applies_to: Any modification within VP1/VP2/VP3 coding region
aav_specific_rules.action: Agent must translate alternate frame and verify no stop codons introduced in AAP
Warn if modifying first 137 residues of VP1

quality_checklist: No internal stop codons in VHH or linkers
AAP reading frame checked (no stop codons)
